stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream polishing the new Egg-Coin radar, debugging missing dynamic lights, and preparing assets (including Biobak’s mushroom line) for the first playable demo. He also explains broader economy changes and briefly outlines the remaining main courses.

development_findings.summary: Each level now contains a seventh star called "Find the Egg Coins" that automatically grants a radar; the radar was moved from a purchasable item to a guaranteed tool to avoid player frustration.
development_findings.quote: Imagine you have not bought the radar and you're doing a mission 7 and the game doesn't give you any hint at all – that's gonna suck.

development_findings.summary: The radar’s behaviour is based on Sonic Adventure 1: its icon blinks faster and changes colour as Mario approaches a coin; Kaze is experimenting with blink speed, transparency, and per-course colours to reduce distraction.
development_findings.quote: It is very similar to Sonic Adventure 1 but we’re tweaking the visuals so it’s less distracting.

development_findings.summary: 100-coin stars have been removed; coins are now a global currency used to purchase overworld changes and upgrades.
development_findings.quote: Points are global now. The 100-coin missions do not exist anymore.

development_findings.summary: Example upgrade: an NPC may ask for 500 coins to build a bridge, permanently altering the overworld and reinforcing coin value.
development_findings.quote: You're actually going to affect the world by giving people money – that's gonna be so cool.

development_findings.summary: A bug causing dynamic lights not to spawn was traced to Mario 64’s behaviour parameter: setting behParm3 to 255 prevents the object from appearing.
development_findings.quote: There's a functionality in the Mario 64 engine where if you set the behParm3 to 255 the object does not spawn.

development_findings.summary: Course 1 is almost demo-ready; remaining tasks are adding dynamic lights and importing Biobak’s mushroom line.
Two demos are planned: the imminent demo (multiple courses) and a later, course-1-only demo for focused feedback.
All 15 main courses are now planned: Course 13 = Ice Castle (nearly done), Course 14 = Craft World (mostly done), Course 15 = Space Arcade (block-out stage).
Lighting on Mario that appeared broken in the last showcase video has been fixed for the upcoming demo.
Rumble Pak support is disabled because it would require a dedicated thread and Kaze does not own the hardware.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prioritises player experience, often changing design to avoid potential frustration.
context_findings.quote: I want to avoid that experience happening to anyone.

context_findings.summary: He is frustrated by ParaLLEl Launcher’s frequent update prompts and prefers Project64 for convenience.
context_findings.quote: You don't need to make an update for every little thing.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is content coding in C and shows little interest in new programming languages.
context_findings.quote: C can already do everything we need.

context_findings.summary: He does not own a Rumble Pak and has only five or six shirts, offering small personal glimpses.

biobak.summary: Created a new line of mushrooms for Course 1 that Kaze still needs to integrate.
Provided live feedback on the radar design when Kaze demonstrated it.

zeina.summary: Appeared casually in the stream; Kaze asked her to pick up a second N64, showing personal support outside direct development.

key_stories.title: Making the Radar Mandatory
key_stories.summary: The radar for locating Egg Coins was originally a purchasable item. Kaze realised players might attempt the seventh star without it, leading to a frustrating experience. He converted it into an automatic feature tied to the new seventh act.
key_stories.challenge: Players could start mission 7 without having bought the radar, leaving them with no guidance.
key_stories.process: Re-worked act selection to add a seventh star and hard-wired the radar to that mission.
key_stories.outcome: Every player now receives the radar when it is needed, eliminating the potential pain point.
key_stories.key_quote: Imagine you have not bought the radar and you're doing a mission 7 and the game doesn't give you any hint at all – that's gonna suck.

key_stories.title: The Invisible Dynamic Lights
key_stories.summary: Dynamic crystal lights in Course 1 refused to appear. After investigation, Kaze discovered an obscure engine rule that any object with behParm3 = 255 is automatically culled.
key_stories.challenge: Lights placed in the level were not spawning, with no visible reason.
key_stories.process: Checked spawn tables, confirmed objects existed, traced issue to behaviour parameters.
key_stories.outcome: Parameter adjusted; lights now spawn correctly, clearing a key visual bug for the demo.
key_stories.key_quote: If you set the behParm3 to 255 the object does not spawn. This is so wild.

key_stories.title: Reinventing Coin Value
key_stories.summary: Traditional 100-coin stars were scrapped. Coins now act as a global currency to fund overworld improvements, such as building bridges, making them more meaningful than in previous Mario games.
key_stories.challenge: Standard coin stars felt dull and contradicted the new economy.
key_stories.process: Removed 100-coin missions, designed NPC-driven upgrades that require coin donations.
key_stories.outcome: Coins serve a clear purpose, tying player progression to visible world changes.
key_stories.key_quote: The coins are going to feel more valuable than Mario Odyssey.
